p: Natural populations of medicinal plants have been a valuable source of therapeutic compounds and drug discovery [ 1]. These compounds include polyphenols which may reduce certain age-associated illnesses including cancer and Alzheimerâ€™s disease by confronting escalated cellular damage through significant reduction of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and inflammatory status [ 2, 3]. The antiproliferative and cytotoxic activities of polyphenols against human cancer cells are also attributed to cell cycle arrest and intermolecular regulation of known genes [ 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9].
